content: George Efthymoglou (Department Chair) - Department of Digital Systems Skip to content George Efthymoglou (Department Chair) Phone +30 210-4142756 Email gefthymo@unipi.gr Title Professor Office Hours Wednesday 11.30 - 13.00 Thursday 12.00 - 13.00 Office 505 (150, Androutsou Str, Piraeus, 18532) Courses Advanced Topics in Wireless Communications — 8th semester Signals and Systems — 3rd semester Digital Communications — 5th semester Digital Signal Processing — 6th semester Brief CV George P. Efthymoglou received the B.S. degree in physics from University of Athens, in 1991 and the M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in electrical engineering from Florida Atlantic University, USA, in 1993 and 1997, respectively. From 1993 to 1997 he worked as a telecommunications consultant and gave lectures on the theory and simulation of digital communication systems to employees of companies such as Motorola, Lucent, Harris Corporation, AT&T, and IBM.  In 1998, he joined the R&D group of Signal Processing Worksystem (SPW) at Cadence Design Systems, where he worked in projects related to modeling, simulation, and performance evaluation of 3G wireless systems. In 2002, he joined the Department of Digital Systems at the University of Piraeus where he is currently a Professor. His research interests are in the area of digital communications with emphasis on the performance of cellular and satellite communication systems.
